channel.title: BBC News - Asia

item.title: Afghanistan war: Bodies on the streets as fighting traps Lashkar Gah residents
item.description: Terrified locals are fleeing if they can as the Taliban and troops battle to control Lashkar Gah.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: TikTok becomes the unofficial behind-the-scenes Olympic channel
item.description: The short-form video platform is giving fans unprecedented insight into the athletes' experience.

item.title: Afghanistan: Lashkar Gah residents urged to evacuate amid Taliban battle
item.description: People are told to flee Lashkar Gah ahead of a major army operation against the Taliban.

item.title: Wuhan: Chinese city to test entire population after virus resurfaces
item.description: The city of 11 million people is known to be the site where the coronavirus first emerged in 2019.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Australian athletes 'damaged rooms and misbehaved on flight home'
item.description: Australian athletes damaged beds in their Olympic village hotel rooms and put a hole in a wall before leaving, the country's Olympic committee says.

item.title: Qantas stands down 2,500 staff over Sydney lockdown
item.description: The airline says it expects Australia's largest city to be closed for at least two more months.

item.title: Shares slide after China brands online games 'electronic drugs'
item.description: In recent months Beijing has cracked down on China's technology and private education industries.

item.title: England v India: Visitors look for redemption as Test series begins
item.description: India have lost their last three Test series in England, but they are eager to script a new future.

item.title: Covid vaccine inequity 'completely unacceptable and unethical'
item.description: Rich countries need to do more to give vaccines to poor countries, says top WHO adviser Helen Clark.

item.title: Finance firms plan to close coal plants in Asia
item.description: The Asian Development Bank aims to have the plan ready for the COP26 climate conference in November.

item.title: Nanjing: Concerns in China grow as Delta outbreak spreads
item.description: Authorities are carrying out mass testing and have imposed sweeping lockdowns across 15 provinces.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: A parent's plea in the shadow of the Olympics
item.description: This dad is drawing attention to what he calls the kidnapping of children by their own parents in Japan.

item.title: China flood death toll rises sharply to over 300
item.description: More victims are discovered following the severe floods that engulfed Henan province in July.

item.title: Giant panda twins born in French zoo
item.description: The event is described as "exceptional" by experts, as panda reproduction is notoriously difficult.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Chinese nationalists turn on their athletes
item.description: To ultra-nationalists online, losing an Olympic medal is being "unpatriotic", experts say.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics 2020: Can Indian men's hockey end 41-year drought?
item.description: The Indian men's team won the last of their eight Olympic gold medals in Moscow in 1980.

item.title: Covid-19: The mystery of rising infections in India's Kerala
item.description: Covid-19 cases continue to rise in Kerala despite the waning of the second wave elsewhere in India.

item.title: Afghanistan: Orphan's reunion with British soldier after 19 years
item.description: Ramin Paikar was among the orphans visited by British soldiers stationed in Kabul in 2002.

item.title: How South Korea's migrant wives are breaking the glass ceiling
item.description: Many arrived not knowing the language, but are now carving out a significant place in society.

item.title: Weightlifter at the centre of sport's transgender debate
item.description: Weightlifter Laurel Hubbard is set to become the first openly transgender athlete to compete in a different gender category to that which they were born at an Olympics.

item.title: India reptile park struggles to survive amid Covid
item.description: The future is uncertain for the thousands of snakes, lizards and crocodiles at the Guindy Snake Park.

item.title: From Afghan interpreter to US homeless - the long road to the American dream
item.description: Thousands of Afghan interpreters have waited years to flee to the US. Arriving is a different story.

item.title: 'Liberate Hong Kong': The slogan that will land you in jail
item.description: An eight-character phrase popularised during the protests has landed one man in jail for nine years.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: The medal winners' flowers that pay tribute to 2011 disaster
item.description: More than 5,000 bouquets are being handed to athletes at the Olympic and Paralympic Games - and have a special significance, with flowers from areas devastated by a 2011 earthquake and tsunami.
